meanings.definition: A small hole or opening through which to look, especially into a room or other enclosed space.
meanings.sent1: I peeked through the peephole to see who was knocking on the door.
meanings.sent2: The detective used the peephole to spy on the suspect in the interrogation room.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to peek through the peephole but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like tiny peepholes, observing every detail in the room.
meanings.sent5: The peephole revealed a glimpse of the mysterious figure standing outside.

meanings.definition: To look furtively through a small opening or from a concealed location.
meanings.sent1: She peepholed through the fence to catch a glimpse of the secret garden.
meanings.sent2: The spy peepholes from behind the bushes to gather information discreetly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loved to peephole on his siblings playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to peephole into her soul, understanding her deepest thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The investigator peepholed into the suspect's hideout, gathering crucial evidence.
